medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began abruptly at 2am, waking the patient from sleep. The pain is non-radiating and associated with nausea and one episode of clear emesis. The pain is somewhat alleviated by medications received in the ED but persists in the epigastrium. The patient reports feeling bloated, with no flatus and a last bowel movement noted on a specified date. This is the first time such symptoms have occurred.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Prior abdominal and inguinal hernia surgeries, Benign Prostatic Hyperplasia (BPH), and a partial prostatectomy.
